sentences: Charles Eddie-Lee Hamilton, Jr. (born November 10, 1987) is an American rapper, singer, and record producer
section: N/A

sentences: In addition to his solo career, he was a former member of The Chosen Few, and was also a member of the Lupe Fiasco's All City Chess Club.
section: N/A

sentences: Intent on pursuing a solo career as a rapper, Hamilton signed to independent record label Demevolist Music Group.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2008, Hamilton released a series of mixtapes entitled The Hamiltonization Process, and on December 8, 2008, Hamilton independently released his debut album entitled The Pink Lavalamp.
section: N/A

sentences: Hamilton gained major recognition after being featured on the cover of the XXL's 2009 Freshmen Class issue and signing an undisclosed million dollar distribution record deal with Interscope Records, in 2008.
section: N/A

sentences: Hamilton was due to release his major-label debut album for Interscope entitled This Perfect Life but, in late 2009, due to Hamilton's undiagnosed bipolar disorder at the time, he became a frequent source of controversy and public scrutiny for his conduct on social media and in public settings, causing Hamilton to be dropped from the record label.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2010, Hamilton signed a new record deal with NewCo Records and was due to release a new debut album entitled My Heart, but for unknown reasons Hamilton left the label and shelved the album.
section: N/A

sentences: Through 2011–14, Hamilton began to independently release mixtapes, frequently from his personal blogs, and also had much of his unreleased shelved musical projects leak online.
section: N/A

sentences: In early 2015, Hamilton signed new record deals with Turn First Records and Republic Records.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2014, Hamilton released an EP entitled The Black Box.
section: N/A

sentences: Hamilton released his debut major-label album entitled Hamilton, Charles in 2016.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2015, Hamilton made a musical cameo in the hip hop TV show Empire.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

== Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings =
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Charles Hamilton was born and raised in Cleveland, Ohio,He was exposed to music at an early age: "My mother was an entertainment journalist for the Cleveland Call and Post, so she would take me with her to events when I was just a baby."
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton stated his mother always made sure he had an instrument around him.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: His mother put different kinds of instruments in the basement of their Cleveland home, but he naturally gravitated to the keyboard.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton has stated, "At first, I was just playing the rhythm of the songs I would hear...
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The older I got, the more proficient I got at hearing the notes."
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: For most of his life, Hamilton was self-taught.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Picking up the lead and bass guitar in his teenage years, as well as the drums and harmonica.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton has stated that listening to other genres of music, being exposed to different cultures and experiencing life helped mold his musical sound.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton would leave from his mother's home at the age of 18 and would at times be homeless spending his nights at his friends' houses.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton would later utilize a studio built at the Frederick Douglass Academy.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton would spend countless hours in the studio, developing his craft and his own signature sound.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton stated, "The Lab (FDA's studio) means so much to me, because when I literally didn't have anywhere else to go in the world, I can just go into my beloved alma mater and purge myself creatively."
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The studio in the Frederick Douglass Academy is where most of Charles Hamilton's music is made.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton has also stated, regarding FDA's studio, that "[I] can do my thing in other studios.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: It's just something about home that makes my music breathe."
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton attended Rice High School in Harlem, where he would also participate in freestyle rap battles.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Hamilton would later meet his future manager Le'Roy Benros after offering to help with a music event that he was organizing.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: When Benros eventually heard his music he was "blown away" and arranged a meeting at Hamilton's high school in Harlem.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Benros set about promoting his first client in any way that he could, burning CDs, putting him on at showcases and securing his first appearance on the influential blog "You Heard That New".
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He also managed to introduce Hamilton to Theo Sedlmayr, one of the most powerful entertainment lawyers in the music industry.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: June 16, 2008 saw the release of Hamilton's debut mixtape Crash Landed; a week later, on June 27, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape Outside Looking.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On August 14, 2008, Hamilton announced he was officially signed to Interscope Records, after well known artist/producer/songwriter Pharrell introduced Hamilton to Interscope Records CEO at the time, Jimmy Iovine.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: Later in August, Hamilton would announce that he would release a series of 8 mixtapes entitled "The Hamiltonization Process"; it would be titled after his former personal blog at the time.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On September 2, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape Death Of The Mixtape Rapper, which would be the first release in "The Hamiltonization Process": a series of mixtapes written and produced by Hamilton which would lead up to the release of his debut album, The Pink Lavalamp.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On September 16, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: And Then They Played Dilla.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: The mixtape was a dedication to producer J Dilla, and the mixtape cover was based on J Dilla's critically acclaimed album Donuts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On September 30, 2008, Hamilton and Demevolist Music Group released their mixtape Staff Development.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: Then, on October 15, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape It's Charles Hamilton; the mixtape cover was based on Nas critically acclaimed album Illmatic.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On October 28, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape The L Word.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: A few weeks later, on November 11, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape Sonic The Hamilton.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On November 18, 2008, Hamilton released his debut single "Brooklyn Girls"; the music video would feature a cameo appearance from pornographic actress Lacey Duvalle, who Hamilton had earlier that year made a dedication song towards entitled "Lacey Duvalle".
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On November 25, 2008, Hamilton released his mixtape Intervention.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: On December 8, 2008, Hamilton released his debut album entitled The Pink Lavalamp.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: The album was originally supposed to had been released as Hamilton's major-label debut studio album, but due to Hamilton disagreements with Interscope Records about having his single "Brooklyn Girls" placed on the album's tracklist, he decided it would be best to release it as a free independent release with his label Demevolist Music Group.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: The album would go on to have critically acclaimed reviews and build Hamilton a cult following; it would be the last release in "The Hamiltonization Process".
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–09: Signing to Interscope Records, "The Hamiltonization Process" and The Pink Lavalamp ===

sentences: In 2008, Hamilton was chosen for the XXL's 2009 Freshmen cover issue alongside fellow rappers Wale, B.o.B, Asher Roth, Cory Gunz, Blu, Mickey Factz, Ace Hood, Curren$y and Kid Cudi.

sentences: That May, a video went viral of Hamilton first rap battling, then getting assaulted by his former girlfriend/fellow rapper Briana Latrise, the stepdaughter of Mary J. Blige, due to Hamilton referencing during the battle Latrise having an abortion.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: On May 25, 2009, during an interview, they publicly apologized to each other, with Hamilton stating, "I apologize honestly for putting some things out there that shouldn't have been out there.

sentences: I just wanted to tell you I apologize because I know what I shouldn't have said", and with Latrise remarking, "I'm going to thank you for your apology.

sentences: We're going to talk about our personal business, on our personal time.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: "Hamilton was to release his first studio album on Interscope, entitled This Perfect Life, in 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: According to Hamilton's blog at the time, the album was to be released digitally on June 23, 2009, and the physical copy in stores on August 25, 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: The album was supposed to be Hamilton's major label debut and the first album distributed by a major record label for free download on Charles Hamilton's own website.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: There was also a physical copy of the album that would have to be purchased in stores that included a DVD of animated videos to help the listener get a better feel for the music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: On August 17, 2009, Hamilton released This Perfect Life EP as promotion for the album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: When the cover for This Perfect Life was released, Hamilton caused some controversy when the deceased producer, J Dilla, was named as executive producer.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: A handful of Dilla's closest associates through hip hop began speaking out against Hamilton's use of the name and its connection to his music.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: Hamilton later stated he wished to financially help J Dilla's mother, who had thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura, the same illness that took J Dilla's life.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: J Dilla's name was later removed from the album artwork due to legal reasons.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: After months of speculation, the album was never released as a result of Hamilton getting dropped from Interscope on September 19, 2009, for multiple reasons, including but not limited to his poor performance at a Penn State rap battle and his unapproved crediting of J Dilla.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: Manager Le'Roy Benros later explained why he felt Hamilton's career stalled by telling HitQuarters:

sentences: "I think things happened too fast.

sentences: I don't think we were well prepared for what was given to us."
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: On September 24, 2009, the full album of This Perfect Life was released digitally by Hamilton himself and was leaked on various websites.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: This Perfect Life and release from Interscope ===

sentences: Later that year, on December 28, 2009, Hamilton returned with his first mixtape after being released from Interscope, entitled Normalcy.

sentences: On February 18, 2015, it was announced and confirmed that Hamilton had signed a second label deal with Republic Records; it was also announced that Hamilton's 1st single, "New York Raining" featuring Rita Ora, would be featured on the first soundtrack for Fox's high-rated TV series Empire.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On March 18, 2015, "New York Raining" was released as Hamilton's first single since "Gauchos" in 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On April 15, 2015, Hamilton would announce he would be releasing an extended play before he would release his debut album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On May 19, 2015, Hamilton would announce that his extended play would be entitled The Black Box.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On May 26, 2015, Hamilton would announce that he will also be releasing a mixtape entitled Kill the Reaper, but Hamilton would later shelve the project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: In an interview with Mr. Wavvy released on July 8, 2015, Hamilton suggested that Lupe Fiasco (whom he had been opening for on tour at the time of the interview) would appear on a song with him in the near future.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On August 19, 2015, Hamilton revealed the cover art and the release date for his upcoming EP The Black Box revealing it would be released on September 18, 2015.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On September 17, 2015, Hamilton would reveal via Twitter that he had push the release date back for his upcoming EP The Black Box.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On December 11, 2015, Hamilton would release his EP The Black Box.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: On October 28, 2016, Hamilton would announce that the release date for his upcoming major-label debut album Hamilton, Charles, would be released on December 2, 2016; it was ultimately pushed back a week and released on December 9, 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Signing to Republic and Hamilton, Charles ===

sentences: 2017–present:
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: To commemorate the tenth anniversary of his debut studio album, The Pink Lavalamp, Hamilton released a reissue of the album on CD and as a vinyl record on July 20, 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: On June 15, 2019, Charles Hamilton released "Ralph Nader", his first live-action music video since "New York Raining".
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: Hamilton has started a music label with longtime video collaborator Markus "MK" Allen.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: Hamilton collaborated with Massachusetts & Florida based producer/emcee Serious Truth on the EP Controversial, which was released on May 25, 2021.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: Controversial, containing no samples, is an original composition from front to back, with Serious Truth having played the synth, bass, electric piano and drum machine throughout the entire project.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: Writing and recording credits are split between Charles Hamilton and Serious Truth, with the latter also handling the cover artwork as well as audio engineering and post production aspects.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Pink Lavalamp reissue and return to independent music ===

sentences: In 2008, the label signed to a distribution deal at Interscope, but in 2009 the label would be dropped by Interscope due to the controversy that was surrounding current president at the time Charles Hamilton.

sentences: Musical style ==
section: == Musical style ==
== Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: Influences ===
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: Hamilton has frequently named American rapper Eminem as his biggest influence in his music.
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: On May 6, 2009, during an issue of XXL, Eminem revealed he had worked with Hamilton in late 2007 and fellow rapper B.o.B., stating, "Charles Hamilton I've worked with a couple of years ago, toward the end of 2007.
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: I just made the beat to a song, but, you know, Charles Hamilton is dope."
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: On May 12, 2010, Hamilton penned a 1,000 word open dedication letter to Eminem.
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: Hamilton has also named artists Incubus, N.E.R.D., Jay Z, Modest Mouse, Korn, Dr. Dre, Thelonious Monk, Aerosmith, 50 Cent, Marilyn Manson, The Alchemist, The Isley Brothers, Kanye West, Nine Inch Nails, Hi-Tek, DMX and Mase as other influences in his music, stating "I just love good music.
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===

sentences: Good music that tells a story."
section: == Musical style == | === Influences ===
== Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: Rapping technique
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===
== Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: Hamilton has been known for his clear enunciation and his story-telling rhymes focusing on depression, hope, social injustice, drugs, Sega, women and religion.
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: Hamilton is also known for carrying a concept over a series of albums, complex rhyme schemes, bending words so they rhyme, melody hooks, varied, humorous subject matter, multisyllabic rhymes, adding many rhymes to a bar, having complex rhythms, being able to freestyle rap over long lengthy periods of time and being a musical workaholic.
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: In 2009 during an interview Hamilton would explain his rapping technique, According to Hamilton:
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: "I don't know how to read music, but I know how to sound music.
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: So like, if I'm on beat, but not flowing, then I'm definitely easing in and out of the beat.
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===

sentences: I call it time mathematics, to be able to know how many words you can fit at a certain speed before your time is up."
section: == Musical style == | === Rapping technique ===
== Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: Record production and songwriting ===
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: Hamilton also produces records and song writes for other artist as well, Hamilton is known for producing a majority of his own records.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: Hamilton is also known in his production style for his sampling of soul songs.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: In 2007 during an interview Hamilton talked about his sampling methods.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: According to Hamilton "When I sample, I'm not just doing it to sound good.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: I'm trying to tell a story.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: To convey an emotion.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: If I sampled it, there is a reason I sampled it.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: I believe that music is based on moments, and that there are some moments that people may have missed back in the day.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: They may have even missed it a year ago.
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===

sentences: When I sample, I'm giving the artist their respect, while simultaneously creating something new."
section: == Musical style == | === Record production and songwriting ===
